description: This is a shell script used for configuring wireless interfaces, restarting hostapd services, modifying network configurations, and managing system services related to a router or access point device.

methods.name: Restart_Hostapd
methods.description: Restarts the hostapd service on the 2G interface, killing existing instances and relaunching the daemon with configuration from /nvram/hostapd0.conf.

methods.name: Restart_Hostapd_5G
methods.description: Restarts the hostapd service for the 5G interface, including module removal and insertion for rtl8812au and 88x2bu drivers.

methods.name: Hostapd_Restart
methods.description: Kills current hostapd process and restarts it on the 2G interface, bringing interfaces up as needed.
